traffic_mimicry.name: Traffic Mimicry
traffic_mimicry.description:
Traffic Mimicry Attack that disguises bypass attempts as legitimate application traffic.

    This attack analyzes the target domain and selects an appropriate traffic profile
    to mimic, then generates packet sequences that match the behavioral patterns
    of popular applications.

tcp_window_scaling.name: Tcp Window Scaling
tcp_window_scaling.description:
TCP Window Scaling Attack - manipulates TCP window scaling options.

    Migrated from:
    - apply_tcp_window_scaling (fast_bypass.py)

tcp_options_modification.name: TCP Options Modification
tcp_options_modification.description: Modify TCP options to evade DPI detection while fragmenting

options_type.description: Type of TCP options to add

test_cases.name: TCP options with MSS test
test_cases.description: Test TCP options modification with MSS option

test_cases.name: TCP options with timestamp test
test_cases.description: Test TCP options modification with timestamp option

tcp_sequence_manipulation.name: Tcp Sequence Manipulation
tcp_sequence_manipulation.description:
TCP Sequence Number Manipulation Attack - creates ambiguity in TCP sequence numbers.
    This is intended for testing DPI resilience to non-standard sequence numbering.

tcp_window_manipulation.name: Tcp Window Manipulation
tcp_window_manipulation.description:
Advanced TCP Window Manipulation Attack - modifies TCP window size in various ways.
    This is intended for testing DPI resilience to non-standard window sizes.

tcp_fragmentation.name: Tcp Fragmentation
tcp_fragmentation.description: TCP Fragmentation Attack - splits TCP payload into multiple segments.

urgent_pointer_manipulation.name: Urgent Pointer Manipulation
urgent_pointer_manipulation.description:
Urgent Pointer Attack - manipulates TCP urgent pointer.

    Migrated from:
    - apply_urgent_pointer_manipulation (fast_bypass.py)

tcp_options_padding.name: Tcp Options Padding
tcp_options_padding.description:
TCP Options Padding Attack - adds TCP options padding.

    Migrated from:
    - apply_tcp_options_padding (fast_bypass.py)

tcp_multisplit.name: Tcp Multisplit
tcp_multisplit.description:
TCP Multi-Split Attack - splits payload into multiple segments.
    ENHANCED: Now handles split_count, seqovl, and fooling parameters directly.

tcp_timestamp_manipulation.name: Tcp Timestamp Manipulation
tcp_timestamp_manipulation.description:
TCP Timestamp Attack - manipulates TCP timestamps.

    Migrated from:
    - apply_tcp_timestamp_manipulation (fast_bypass.py)

tcp_wssize_limit.name: Tcp Wssize Limit
tcp_wssize_limit.description:
TCP Window Size Limit Attack - limits TCP window size to confuse DPI.

    This attack sets the TCP window size to a very small value (typically 1 or 2)
    to make the connection appear slow or constrained, potentially bypassing
    DPI systems that expect normal window sizes.

    Migrated from:
    - apply_wssize_limit (fast_bypass.py)

badsum_race.name: Badsum Race
badsum_race.description:
Bad Checksum Race Attack.

    This attack exploits race conditions by sending a fake packet with an
    invalid checksum followed immediately by a real packet. The goal is to
    poison the DPI cache with the fake packet while the real packet reaches
    the target successfully.

    The attack sequence:
    1. Send fake packet with bad checksum (will be dropped by target)
    2. Immediately send real packet with correct checksum
    3. DPI may cache the fake packet and miss the real one

low_ttl_poisoning.name: Low Ttl Poisoning
low_ttl_poisoning.description:
Low TTL Cache Poisoning Attack.

    This attack sends packets with progressively low TTL values to poison
    DPI caches at different network hops. The packets expire before reaching
    the target but may be cached by intermediate DPI systems.

cache_confusion_race.name: Cache Confusion Race
cache_confusion_race.description:
Cache Confusion Attack using Multiple Race Conditions.

    This attack combines multiple race condition techniques to create
    maximum confusion in DPI caching systems by sending competing
    packets with different characteristics simultaneously.

md5sig_race.name: Md5Sig Race
md5sig_race.description:
MD5 Signature Race Attack.

    This attack exploits race conditions by sending a fake packet with an
    MD5 signature followed immediately by a real packet. The goal is to
    poison the DPI cache with the fake packet while the real packet reaches
    the target successfully.

    The attack sequence:
    1. Send fake packet with MD5 signature (will be processed by DPI)
    2. Immediately send real packet without MD5 signature
    3. DPI may cache the fake packet and miss the real one

drip_feed.name: Drip Feed
drip_feed.description:
Drip Feed Attack for Gradual Data Transmission.

    This attack sends data in very small chunks with controlled timing
    to bypass DPI systems that have thresholds for data rate analysis
    or that timeout on slow connections.

timing_based_evasion.name: Timing Based Evasion
timing_based_evasion.description:
Timing-Based Evasion Attack - introduces delays between segments.

    Migrated from:
    - apply_timing_based_evasion (fast_bypass.py)

burst_timing_evasion.name: Burst Timing Evasion
burst_timing_evasion.description:
Burst Timing Evasion Attack - sends payload in bursts with delays.

    Migrated from:
    - apply_burst_timing_evasion (fast_bypass.py)

badsum_fooling.name: Badsum Fooling
badsum_fooling.description:
Bad Checksum Fooling Attack - corrupts TCP checksum to fool DPI.

    Migrated from:
    - apply_badsum_fooling (fast_bypass.py)

md5sig_fooling.name: Md5Sig Fooling
md5sig_fooling.description:
MD5 Signature Fooling Attack - adds fake MD5 signature to fool DPI.

    Migrated from:
    - apply_md5sig_fooling (fast_bypass.py)

badseq_fooling.name: Badseq Fooling
badseq_fooling.description:
Bad Sequence Fooling Attack - corrupts TCP sequence numbers to fool DPI.

    Migrated from:
    - apply_badseq_fooling (fast_bypass.py)

ttl_manipulation.name: Ttl Manipulation
ttl_manipulation.description:
TTL Manipulation Attack - manipulates IP TTL values to fool DPI.

    This attack uses low TTL values to make packets expire before reaching
    the target, potentially poisoning DPI caches.
